title: Glenfinnan's Harry Potter viaduct focus of £1.7m upgrade
description: A fence protecting visitors to Glenfinnan Viaduct is to be renewed and "dangerous" trees are to be removed.

title: Moeen felt he was 'always one of first to be blamed' with England
description: Moeen Ali says feeling as though he was "always one of the first guys to get the blame" has been "probably the hardest bit" about representing England.

title: Prince Harry on first royal duty since talks with Queen
description: The prince hosts the Rugby League World Cup draw after saying he wants to step back as a senior royal.

title: England drawn alongside Samoa, France and Greece in Rugby League World Cup
description: Hosts England will face Samoa, France and Greece in the group stage of the 2021 Rugby League World Cup.

title: Knife possession offences in England and Wales reach record high
description: There were 14,135 offences in the year to September 2019 - the most since data was first compiled in 2007.

title: Trump 'knew exactly what was going on', Giuliani aide claims
description: Lev Parnas, an aide to the president's lawyer, says Donald Trump knew of efforts to pressure Ukraine.

title: The Great British Bake Off: Sandi Toksvig to leave after three years
description: The presenter is leaving the Channel 4 show in order to focus on other work commitments.

title: Brexit: Fundraising appeal launched for Big Ben chimes
description: A crowdfunding project aims to raise £500,000 by the weekend to pay for the bell to ring on 31 January.

title: Megaphone 'ear assault' union boss cleared
description: James Farrar was charged with assault by beating for using a megaphone near the ears of police.

title: Rocky Johnson, Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson's wrestler father, dies at 75
description: Rocky Johnson, the first black WWE tag team champion, is hailed as a "barrier-breaking performer".

title: Australian Open will go ahead despite health concerns, says tournament director
description: Australian Open tournament director Craig Tiley says the tournament "is happening" despite health concerns over Melbourne's air quality.

title: Asda trials refills at 'sustainability store'
description: Shoppers can fill their own containers at the store, as the supermarket tries to reduce plastic waste.

title: NHS tells betting firms to stop 'vicious gambling cycle'
description: Free bets and other incentives should be banned to make gambling safer, a letter to companies says.

title: Australia fires: Rain finally falls on some bushfires
description: Wet weather brings relief to some devastated areas, but the fire crisis is far from over.

title: Scottish FA expected to ban children heading footballs within weeks
description: Rules could be in place within weeks after a study found ex-players are more likely to die of dementia.

title: Conor McGregor v Donald Cerrone: MMA expert breaks down fighting styles
description: MMA expert and coach Eric Nicksick breaks down the fighting styles of Conor McGregor and Donald Cerrone before their showdown in Las Vegas on Saturday.

title: What is climate change? A really simple guide
description: BBC News looks at what we know and don't know about the Earth's changing climate.

title: 'I'll remind you how I made this game' - McGregor on return to UFC
description: Conor McGregor vows to "remind everyone" of his MMA prowess as when he returns at UFC 246 on Saturday.

title: Why are Chinese fishermen finding so many 'submarine spies'?
description: Fisherman are catching foreign "spy drones" – giving us a rare insight into covert sea surveillance.

title: The Papers: 'Dazzling duchess' Kate and Putin's Kremlin revamp
description: William and Kate's first engagement since 'Megexit' and Putin's Kremlin plans lead some newspapers.

title: BBC launches new climate coverage
description: The BBC plans a raft of new services and shows examining climate change and the state of our planet.

title: Our Planet Matters: Climate change explained
description: It's been linked to a year of extremes – from bushfires to torrential rains – but what is it?

title: Sir David Attenborough warns of climate 'crisis moment'
description: We're at a pivotal point in efforts to tackle climate change, the naturalist and broadcaster warns.

title: Running Stories: 'Epilepsy was a blessing in disguise'
description: Ellie-May is a runner who stopped partying and lost mates due to epilepsy but running changed that.

title: 'I was sexually abused by a shaman at an ayahuasca retreat'
description: Ayahuasca's psychedelic powers are attracting more and more tourists. But the scene appears to have a dark side.

title: Meet the NASA intern who discovered a new planet on his third day
description: This teenager found a new planet on the third day of his internship at the US space agency.

title: Iran protests: Who are the opposition in the country?
description: There have been anti-government protests in Iran, but how strong is opposition inside the country?

title: Why are opioids still given for chronic pain?
description: Opioids work only for some with long-term pain - so why are they still being given to patients?

title: Inside the Old Bailey as filming ban to be lifted
description: From inside the Old Bailey, Clive Coleman explains what we can expect once cameras are allowed in.

title: Hip-hop artist: 'I'm called Satan when I rap'
description: "Mina the Veiled" is a Senegalese hip-hop artist who is often mocked because of her passion for rap.

title: South Ronaldsay's 'amazing' horse costumes inspire catwalk collection
description: Girls on South Ronaldsay dress in elaborate outfits at a festival thought to date back at least 200 years.

title: Indyref2: What does 'once in a generation' mean?
description: Boris Johnson keeps saying the 2014 indyref was a "once in a generation" event - but what does this mean?

title: Why is kosher food soaring in popularity?
description: Sales of kosher accredited food is booming around the world, with more and more firms getting in on act.

title: Buddha heirloom returned to Sri Lanka by Hampshire family
description: Relatives of a Sri Lankan archaeologist return a Buddha relic to a sacred temple 100 years later.
